api/Spectacles.NET.Types.GatewayEvent.ht.title: Enum GatewayEvent | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Types.GatewayEvent.ht.keywords: Enum GatewayEvent Events are payloads sent over the socket to a client that correspond to events in Discord. Namespace : Spectacles.NET.Types Assembly : Spectacles.NET.Types.dll Syntax public enum GatewayEvent : int Fields Name Description CHANNEL_CREATE new channel created CHANNEL_DELETE channel was deleted CHANNEL_PINS_UPDATE message was pinned or unpinned CHANNEL_UPDATE channel was updated GUILD_BAN_ADD user was banned from a guild GUILD_BAN_REMOVE user was unbanned from a guild GUILD_CREATE lazy-load for unavailable guild, guild became available, or user joined a new guild GUILD_DELETE guild became unavailable, or user left/was removed from a guild GUILD_EMOJIS_UPDATE guild emojis were updated GUILD_INTEGRATIONS_UPDATE guild integration was updated GUILD_MEMBER_ADD new user joined a guild GUILD_MEMBER_REMOVE user was removed from a guild GUILD_MEMBER_UPDATE guild member was updated GUILD_MEMBERS_CHUNK response to Request Guild Members GUILD_ROLE_CREATE guild role was created GUILD_ROLE_DELETE guild role was deleted GUILD_ROLE_UPDATE guild role was updated GUILD_UPDATE guild was updated INVITE_CREATE invite to a channel was created INVITE_DELETE invite to a channel was deleted MESSAGE_CREATE message was created MESSAGE_DELETE message was deleted MESSAGE_DELETE_BULK multiple messages were deleted at once MESSAGE_REACTION_ADD user reacted to a message MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE user removed a reaction from a message MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE_ALL all reactions were explicitly removed from a message MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE_EMOJI all reactions for a given emoji were explicitly removed from a message MESSAGE_UPDATE message was edited PRESENCE_UPDATE user was updated PRESENCES_REPLACE used to replace presences after outages, data is null for bot accounts receiving it Bot Accounts should ignore this READY contains the initial state information RESUMED response to Resume TYPING_START user started typing in a channel USER_UPDATE properties about the user changed VOICE_SERVER_UPDATE guild's voice server was updated VOICE_STATE_UPDATE someone joined, left, or moved a voice channel WEBHOOKS_UPDATE guild channel webhook was created, update, or deleted

api/Spectacles.NET.Types.Intents.html.title: Enum Intents | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Types.Intents.html.keywords: Enum Intents The Discord gateway can be spammy. Like, really spammy. For a long time, the dev community has asked us for a way to “subscribe” to only the gateway events their bots need, saving tons of computational cost. With the Gateway Intents system, you tell us on IDENTIFY what you’re planning to do—your "intents"—and we'll send you only the gateway events that you need. Namespace : Spectacles.NET.Types Assembly : Spectacles.NET.Types.dll Syntax public enum Intents : int Fields Name Description DIRECT_MESSAGE_REACTIONS MESSAGE_REACTION_ADD MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE_ALL MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE_EMOJI DIRECT_MESSAGE_TYPING TYPING_START DIRECT_MESSAGES CHANNEL_CREATE MESSAGE_CREATE MESSAGE_UPDATE MESSAGE_DELETE GUILD_BANS GUILD_BAN_ADD GUILD_BAN_REMOVE GUILD_EMOJIS GUILD_EMOJIS_UPDATE GUILD_INTEGRATIONS GUILD_INTEGRATIONS_UPDATE GUILD_INVITES INVITE_CREATE INVITE_DELETE GUILD_MEMBERS GUILD_MEMBER_ADD GUILD_MEMBER_UPDATE GUILD_MEMBER_REMOVE GUILD_MESSAGE_REACTIONS MESSAGE_REACTION_ADD MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE_ALL MESSAGE_REACTION_REMOVE_EMOJI GUILD_MESSAGE_TYPING TYPING_START GUILD_MESSAGES MESSAGE_CREATE MESSAGE_UPDATE MESSAGE_DELETE GUILD_PRESENCES PRESENCE_UPDATE GUILD_VOICE_STATES VOICE_STATE_UPDATE GUILD_WEBHOOKS WEBHOOKS_UPDATE GUILDS GUILD_CREATE GUILD_DELETE GUILD_ROLE_CREATE GUILD_ROLE_UPDATE GUILD_ROLE_DELETE CHANNEL_CREATE CHANNEL_UPDATE CHANNEL_DELETE CHANNEL_PINS_UPDATE

api/Spectacles.NET.Types.GatewayCloseCod.title: Enum GatewayCloseCode | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Types.GatewayCloseCod.keywords: Enum GatewayCloseCode Your connection to our gateway may also sometimes close. When it does, you will receive a close code that tells you what happened. Namespace : Spectacles.NET.Types Assembly : Spectacles.NET.Types.dll Syntax public enum GatewayCloseCode : int Fields Name Description ALREADY_AUTHENTICATED You sent more than one identify payload. Don't do that! AUTHENTICATION_FAILED The account token sent with your identify payload is incorrect. DECODE_ERROR You sent an invalid payload to us. Don't do that! INVALID_SEQ The sequence sent when resuming the session was invalid. Reconnect and start a new session. INVALID_SHARD You sent us an invalid shard when identifying. NOT_AUTHENTICATED You sent us a payload prior to identifying. RATE_LIMITED Woah nelly! You're sending payloads to us too quickly. Slow it down! SESSION_TIMEOUT Your session timed out. Reconnect and start a new one. SHARDING_REQUIRED The session would have handled too many guilds - you are required to shard your connection in order to connect. UNKNOWN_ERROR We're not sure what went wrong. Try reconnecting? UNKNOWN_OP_CODE You sent an invalid Gateway opcode or an invalid payload for an opcode. Don't do that!

api/Spectacles.NET.Types.html.title: Namespace Spectacles.NET.Types | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Types.html.keywords: Namespace Spectacles.NET.Types Classes Activity Represents an activity which is part of a user's presence. ActivityAssets Assets for an Activity ActivityParty Party of an activity ActivitySecrets secrets for Rich Presence joining and spectating ActivityTimestamps Unix timestamps for start and/or end of the game APIEndpoints Constants for the Endpoints of the Discord API. Attachment Represents an attachment in a message. AuditLogBoolChange Audit Log Change with the Type Bool AuditLogChangeBase Base Class for AuditLogChanges AuditLogEntry An Audit Log Entry AuditLogEntryInfo Additional Audit Log info for certain action types AuditLogIntegerChange Audit Log Change with the Type int AuditLogOverwriteChange Audit Log Change with the Type Permission Overwrite Array AuditLogRoleChange Audit Log Change with the Type Role Array AuditLogs Whenever an admin action is performed on the API, an entry is added to the respective guild's audit log. You can specify the reason by attaching the X-Audit-Log-Reason request header. This header supports url encoded utf8 characters. AuditLogStringChange Audit Log Change with the Type String Channel A Discord Channel Represents a guild or DM channel within Discord. See here . ChannelMention Channel Mentioned in a Cross Posted Message ClientApplication OAuth2 application info ClientStatus Active sessions are indicated with an "online", "idle", or "dnd" string per platform. If a user is offline or invisible, the corresponding field is not present. CreateDMPayload Payload to create a DM Channel Embed Represents an embed in a message (image/video preview, rich embed, etc.) EmbedAuthor Author of an Embed EmbedField Field of an Embed EmbedFooter Footer of an Embed EmbedImage Image of an Embed EmbedProvider Provider of an Embed EmbedThumbnail Thumbnail of an Embed EmbedVideo Video of an Embed Emoji An Emoji Represents a custom or unicode emote. See this . Gateway Returns an object with a single valid WSS URL, which the client can use for Connecting. Clients should cache this value and only call this endpoint to retrieve a new URL if they are unable to properly establish a connection using the cached version of the URL. GatewayBot Returns an object based on the information in Get Gateway, plus additional metadata that can help during the operation of large or sharded bots. Unlike the Get Gateway, this route should not be cached for extended periods of time as the value is not guaranteed to be the same per-call, and changes as the bot joins/leaves guilds. Guild Guilds in Discord represent an isolated collection of users and channels, and are often referred to as "servers" in the UI. See here . GuildBanAddPayload The payload for the GuildBanAdd event. GuildBanRemovePayload The payload for the GuildBanRemove event. GuildEmojisUpdate The payload for the GuildEmojisUpdate event. GuildIntegrationsUpdatePayload The payload for the GuildIntegrationsUpdate event. GuildMember Represents a member of a guild on Discord. GuildMemberAddPayload The payload for the GuildMemberAdd event. GuildMemberChunkPayload The Payload for the GuildMemberChunk event. GuildMemberRemovePayload The Payload for the GuildMemberRemove event. GuildMemberUpdatePayload The Payload for the GuildMemberUpdate event. GuildRoleCreatePayload The Payload for the GuildRoleCreate event. GuildRoleDeletePayload The Payload for the GuildRoleDelete event. GuildRoleUpdatePayload The Payload for the GuildRoleUpdate event. HelloPacket Sent on connection to the websocket. Defines the heartbeat interval that the client should heartbeat to. IdentifyPacket The Identify data we send over the Discord Gateway IdentifyProperties The properties send along with the Identify data Integration Represents a guild integration. IntegrationAccount The information account for an integration. Invite Represents a code that when used, adds a user to a guild or group DM channel. InviteCreatePayload Send when a new invite to a channel is created. InviteDeletePayload Sent when an invite is deleted. MentionUser Users in Discord are generally considered the base entity. Users can spawn across the entire platform, be members of guilds, participate in text and voice chat, and much more. Users are separated by a distinction of "bot" vs "normal." Although they are similar, bot users are automated users that are "owned" by another user. Unlike normal users, bot users do not have a limitation on the number of Guilds they can be a part of. Message Represents a message sent in a channel within Discord. MessageActivity Activity sent in a message. MessageApplication Represents a Client OAuth2 Application. MessageDeleteBulkPayload The Payload for the MessageDeleteBulk event. MessageDeletePayload The Payload for the MessageDelete event. MessageReactionAddPayload The Payload for the MessageReactionAdd events. MessageReactionRemoveAllPayload The Payload for the MessageDeleteBulk event. MessageReactionRemoveEmojiPayload Sent when a bot removes all instances of a given emoji from the reactions of a message. MessageReactionRemovePayload The Payload for the MessageReactionRemove events. MessageReference Reference data sent with crossposted messages. MessageUpdatePayload The Payload for the MessageUpdate event. PermissionOverwrite Represents a permission overwrite for a role or member in a guild channel. Presence A user's presence is their current state on a guild. PresenceUpdatePayload The Payload for the PresenceUpdate event. Reaction Represents a reaction to a message. ReadyDispatch The ready event is dispatched when a client has completed the initial handshake with the gateway (for new sessions). The ready event can be the largest and most complex event the gateway will send, as it contains all the state required for a client to begin interacting with the rest of the platform. ReceivePacket A Packet we receive over the Discord gateway RequestGuildMembersDispatch Used to request offline members for a guild or a list of guilds. When initially connecting, the gateway will only send offline members if a guild has less than the large_threshold members (value in the Gateway Identify). If a client wishes to receive additional members, they need to explicitly request them via this operation. The server will send Guild Members Chunk events in response with up to 1000 members per chunk until all members that match the request have been sent. ResumePacket Used to replay missed events when a disconnected client resumes. Role Roles represent a set of permissions attached to a group of users. Roles have unique names, colors, and can be "pinned" to the side bar, causing their members to be listed separately. Roles are unique per guild, and can have separate permission profiles for the global context (guild) and channel context. SendableDispatch A Packet Sent from the Worker to the Gateway where only the GuildId is known and not the ShardCount. SendableMessage A Message which can be sent to Discord's Rest API SendPacket A Packet we send over the Discord gateway SessionStartLimit Information on the current session start limit Team Represents a Client OAuth2 Application Team. TeamMember Represents a Client OAuth2 Application Team Member. TypingStartPayload The Payload for the TypingStart event. UnavailableGuild A partial guild object. Represents an Offline Guild, or a Guild whose information has not been provided through Guild Create events during the Gateway connect. UpdateStatusDispatch Sent by the client to indicate a presence or status update. UpdateVoiceStateDispatch Sent when a client wants to join, move, or disconnect from a voice channel. User Users in Discord are generally considered the base entity. Users can spawn across the entire platform, be members of guilds, participate in text and voice chat, and much more. Users are separated by a distinction of "bot" vs "normal." Although they are similar, bot users are automated users that are "owned" by another user. Unlike normal users, bot users do not have a limitation on the number of Guilds they can be a part of. VoiceServerUpdatePayload The Payload for the VoiceServerUpdate event. VoiceState Used to represent a user's voice connection status. Webhook Webhooks are a low-effort way to post messages to channels in Discord. They do not require a bot user or authentication to use. WebhookUpdatePayload The Payload for the WebhookUpdate event. Interfaces IAuditLogChange<T> Represent an AuditLogChange with T as Value Type IFile Interface for Files attached to Messages Enums ActivityFlags Flags describing an Activity ActivityType Type of an Activity AuditLogEvent Type of action that occurred in an Audit Log Entry ChannelType Type of a Discord Channel DefaultMessageNotificationLevel Default Message Notification Level for a Guild ExplicitContentFilterLevel Explicit Content Filter Level of a Guild GatewayCloseCode Your connection to our gateway may also sometimes close. When it does, you will receive a close code that tells you what happened. GatewayEvent Events are payloads sent over the socket to a client that correspond to events in Discord. GuildFeature Features of a Guild Intents The Discord gateway can be spammy. Like, really spammy. For a long time, the dev community has asked us for a way to “subscribe” to only the gateway events their bots need, saving tons of computational cost. With the Gateway Intents system, you tell us on IDENTIFY what you’re planning to do—your "intents"—and we'll send you only the gateway events that you need. MembershipState The value set for a team members's membership state. MessageActivityType Type of Activity sent in a Message. MessageFlags Flags a Message can have. MessageType Type of a Message in Discord. MFALevel Required MFA level for a guild OpCode All gateway events in Discord are tagged with an opcode that denotes the payload type. Permission Permissions in Discord are a way to limit and grant certain abilities to users. A set of base permissions can be configured at the guild level for different roles. When these roles are attached to users, they grant or revoke specific privileges within the guild. Along with the guild-level permissions, Discord also supports permission overwrites that can be assigned to individual guild roles or guild members on a per-channel basis. Permissions are stored within a 53-bit integer and are calculated using bitwise operations. The total permissions integer can be determined by ORing together each individual value, and flags can be checked using AND operations. PremiumTier Premium Tier of a Guild. PremiumType The type of Nitro subscription on a user's account . Status Status of an User UserFlags The flags on a user's account. UserType the type of target user for this invite VerificationLevel Verification level required for a guild.

api/Spectacles.NET.Types.Role.html.keywords: Class Role Roles represent a set of permissions attached to a group of users. Roles have unique names, colors, and can be "pinned" to the side bar, causing their members to be listed separately. Roles are unique per guild, and can have separate permission profiles for the global context (guild) and channel context. api/Spectacles.NET.Types.MentionUser.htm.title: Class MentionUser | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Types.MentionUser.htm.keywords: Class MentionUser Users in Discord are generally considered the base entity. Users can spawn across the entire platform, be members of guilds, participate in text and voice chat, and much more. Users are separated by a distinction of "bot" vs "normal." Although they are similar, bot users are automated users that are "owned" by another user. Unlike normal users, bot users do not have a limitation on the number of Guilds they can be a part of. api/Spectacles.NET.Types.OpCode.html.title: Enum OpCode | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Types.OpCode.html.keywords: Enum OpCode All gateway events in Discord are tagged with an opcode that denotes the payload type. Namespace : Spectacles.NET.Types Assembly : Spectacles.NET.Types.dll Syntax public enum OpCode : int Fields Name Description DISPATCH dispatches an event HEARTBEAT used for ping checking HEARTBEAT_ACK sent immediately following a client heartbeat that was received HELLO sent immediately after connecting, contains heartbeat and server debug information IDENTIFY used for client handshake INVALID_SESSION used to notify client they have an invalid session id RECONNECT used to tell clients to reconnect to the gateway REQUEST_GUILD_MEMBERS used to request guild members RESUME used to resume a closed connection STATUS_UPDATE used to update the client status VOICE_STATE_UPDATE used to join/move/leave voice channels

api/Spectacles.NET.Util.Logging.LogLevel.title: Enum LogLevel | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Util.Logging.LogLevel.keywords: Enum LogLevel The LogLevel of all Logs. Namespace : Spectacles.NET.Util.Logging Assembly : Spectacles.NET.Util.dll Syntax public enum LogLevel : int Fields Name Description DEBUG Detailed information on the flow through the system. Expect these to be written to logs only. Generally speaking, most lines logged by your application should be written as DEBUG. ERROR Other runtime errors or unexpected conditions. Expect these to be immediately visible on a status console. INFO Interesting runtime events (startup/shutdown). Expect these to be immediately visible on a console, so be conservative and keep to a minimum. TRACE Most detailed information. Expect these to be written to logs only. api/Spectacles.NET.Types.Permission.html.title: Enum Permission | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Types.Permission.html.keywords: Enum Permission Permissions in Discord are a way to limit and grant certain abilities to users. A set of base permissions can be configured at the guild level for different roles. When these roles are attached to users, they grant or revoke specific privileges within the guild. Along with the guild-level permissions, Discord also supports permission overwrites that can be assigned to individual guild roles or guild members on a per-channel basis. Permissions are stored within a 53-bit integer and are calculated using bitwise operations. The total permissions integer can be determined by ORing together each individual value, and flags can be checked using AND operations. Namespace : Spectacles.NET.Types Assembly : Spectacles.NET.Types.dll Syntax public enum Permission : int Fields Name Description ADD_REACTIONS Allows for the addition of reactions to messages ADMINISTRATOR Allows all permissions and bypasses channel permission overwrites ALL All permissions ALL_TEXT All permissions related to Text Channel ALL_VOICE All permissions related to Voice Channel ATTACH_FILES Allows for uploading images and files BAN_MEMBERS Allows banning members CHANGE_NICKNAME Allows for modification of own nickname CONNECT Allows for joining of a voice channel CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE Allows creation of instant invites DEAFEN_MEMBERS Allows for deafening of members in a voice channel DEFAULT Default permissions EMBED_LINKS Links sent by users with this permission will be auto-embedded KICK_MEMBERS Allows kicking members MANAGE_CHANNELS Allows management and editing of channels MANAGE_EMOJIS Allows management and editing of emojis MANAGE_GUILD Allows management and editing of the guild MANAGE_MESSAGES Allows for deletion of other users messages MANAGE_NICKNAMES Allows for modification of other users nicknames MANAGE_ROLES Allows management and editing of roles MANAGE_WEBHOOKS Allows management and editing of webhooks MENTION_EVERYONE Allows for using the @everyone tag to notify all users in a channel, and the @here tag to notify all online users in a channel MOVE_MEMBERS Allows for moving of members between voice channels MUTE_MEMBERS Allows for muting members in a voice channel NONE No permissions PRIORITY_SPEAKER Allows for using priority speaker in a voice channel READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY Allows for reading of message history SEND_MESSAGES Allows for sending messages in a channel SEND_TTS_MESSAGES Allows for sending of /tts messages SPEAK Allows for speaking in a voice channel STREAM Allows the user to go live USE_EXTERNAL_EMOJIS Allows the usage of custom emojis from other servers USE_VAD Allows for using voice-activity-detection in a voice channel VIEW_AUDIT_LOG Allows for viewing of audit logs VIEW_CHANNEL Allows guild members to view a channel, which includes reading messages in text channels

api/Spectacles.NET.Types.User.html.title: Class User | Spectacles.Net Documentation
api/Spectacles.NET.Types.User.html.keywords: Class User Users in Discord are generally considered the base entity. Users can spawn across the entire platform, be members of guilds, participate in text and voice chat, and much more. Users are separated by a distinction of "bot" vs "normal." Although they are similar, bot users are automated users that are "owned" by another user. Unlike normal users, bot users do not have a limitation on the number of Guilds they can be a part of.
